trans-unit.source: Analyze flight delay data with Hive on Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze flight delay data with Hive on Linux-based HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Hive to analyze flight data on Linux-based HDInsight, then export the data to SQL Database using Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Hive to analyze flight data on Linux-based HDInsight, then export the data to SQL Database using Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: Analyze flight delay data by using Hive in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Analyze flight delay data by using Hive in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Learn how to analyze flight delay data using Hive on Linux-based HDInsight then export the data to Azure SQL Database using using Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to analyze flight delay data using Hive on Linux-based HDInsight then export the data to Azure SQL Database using using Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are specific to Linux-based clusters.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] While individual pieces of this document can be used with Windows-based HDInsight clusters (Python and Hive for example,) many steps are specific to Linux-based clusters.

trans-unit.source: For steps that will work with a Windows-based cluster, see [Analyze flight delay data using Hive in HDInsight](hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data.md)
trans-unit.target: For steps that will work with a Windows-based cluster, see [Analyze flight delay data using Hive in HDInsight](hdinsight-analyze-flight-delay-data.md)

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription**.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription**.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: __An HDInsight cluster__.
trans-unit.target: __An HDInsight cluster__.

trans-unit.source: See [Get started using Hadoop with Hive in HDInsight on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) for steps on creating a new Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: See [Get started using Hadoop with Hive in HDInsight on Linux](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) for steps on creating a new Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: __Azure SQL Database__.
trans-unit.target: __Azure SQL Database__.

trans-unit.source: You will use an Azure SQL database as a destination data store.
trans-unit.target: You will use an Azure SQL database as a destination data store.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have a SQL Database already, see [SQL Database tutorial: Create a SQL database in minutes](../sql-database/sql-database-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: If you do not have a SQL Database already, see [SQL Database tutorial: Create a SQL database in minutes](../sql-database/sql-database-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: __Azure CLI__.
trans-unit.target: __Azure CLI__.

trans-unit.source: If you have not installed the Azure CLI, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) for more steps.
trans-unit.target: If you have not installed the Azure CLI, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli-install.md) for more steps.

trans-unit.source: Download the flight data
trans-unit.target: Download the flight data

trans-unit.source: Browse to [Research and Innovative Technology Administration, Bureau of Transportation Statistics][rita-website].
trans-unit.target: Browse to [Research and Innovative Technology Administration, Bureau of Transportation Statistics][rita-website].

trans-unit.source: On the page, select the following values:
trans-unit.target: On the page, select the following values:

trans-unit.source: | Name | Value | | Filter Year | 2013 | | Filter Period | January | | Fields | Year, FlightDate, UniqueCarrier, Carrier, FlightNum, OriginAirportID, Origin, OriginCityName, OriginState, DestAirportID, Dest, DestCityName, DestState, DepDelayMinutes, ArrDelay, ArrDelayMinutes, CarrierDelay, WeatherDelay, NASDelay, SecurityDelay, LateAircraftDelay.
trans-unit.target: | Name | Value | | Filter Year | 2013 | | Filter Period | January | | Fields | Year, FlightDate, UniqueCarrier, Carrier, FlightNum, OriginAirportID, Origin, OriginCityName, OriginState, DestAirportID, Dest, DestCityName, DestState, DepDelayMinutes, ArrDelay, ArrDelayMinutes, CarrierDelay, WeatherDelay, NASDelay, SecurityDelay, LateAircraftDelay.

trans-unit.source: Clear all other fields |
trans-unit.target: Clear all other fields |

trans-unit.source: Click **Download**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Download**.

trans-unit.source: Upload the data
trans-unit.target: Upload the data

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to upload the zip file to the HDInsight cluster head node:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to upload the zip file to the HDInsight cluster head node:

trans-unit.source: Replace __FILENAME__ with the name of the zip file.
trans-unit.target: Replace __FILENAME__ with the name of the zip file.

trans-unit.source: Replace __USERNAME__ with the SSH login for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace __USERNAME__ with the SSH login for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you use a password to authenticate your SSH login, you will be prompted for the password.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you use a password to authenticate your SSH login, you will be prompted for the password.

trans-unit.source: If you used a public key, you may need to use the `-i` parameter and specify the path to the matching private key.
trans-unit.target: If you used a public key, you may need to use the `-i` parameter and specify the path to the matching private key.

trans-unit.source: For example `scp -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa FILENAME.csv USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:`.
trans-unit.target: For example `scp -i ~/.ssh/id_rsa FILENAME.csv USERNAME@CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net:`.

trans-unit.source: Once the upload has completed, connect to the cluster using SSH:
trans-unit.target: Once the upload has completed, connect to the cluster using SSH:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with Linux-based HDInsight, see the following articles:

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md)

trans-unit.source: Once connected, use the following to unzip the .zip file:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, use the following to unzip the .zip file:

trans-unit.source: This will extract a .csv file that is roughly 60MB in size.
trans-unit.target: This will extract a .csv file that is roughly 60MB in size.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create a new directory on WASB (the distributed data store used by HDInsight,) and copy the file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create a new directory on WASB (the distributed data store used by HDInsight,) and copy the file:

trans-unit.source: hadoop fs -mkdir -p /tutorials/flightdelays/data hadoop fs -copyFromLocal FILENAME.csv /tutorials/flightdelays/data/FILENAME.csv
trans-unit.target: hadoop fs -mkdir -p /tutorials/flightdelays/data hadoop fs -copyFromLocal FILENAME.csv /tutorials/flightdelays/data/FILENAME.csv

trans-unit.source: Create and run the HiveQL
trans-unit.target: Create and run the HiveQL

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to import data from the CSV file into a Hive table named __Delays__.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to import data from the CSV file into a Hive table named __Delays__.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to create and edit a new file named __flightdelays.hql__:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to create and edit a new file named __flightdelays.hql__:

trans-unit.source: Use the following as the contents of this file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following as the contents of this file:

trans-unit.source: Use __Ctrl + X__, then __Y__ to save the file.
trans-unit.target: Use __Ctrl + X__, then __Y__ to save the file.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to start Hive and run the __flightdelays.hql__ file:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to start Hive and run the __flightdelays.hql__ file:

trans-unit.source: This will run the file, then return a `hive>` prompt.
trans-unit.target: This will run the file, then return a `hive>` prompt.

trans-unit.source: When you receive the `hive>` prompt, use the following to retrieve data from the imported flight delay data.
trans-unit.target: When you receive the `hive>` prompt, use the following to retrieve data from the imported flight delay data.

trans-unit.source: This will retrieve a list of cities that experienced weather delays, along with the average delay time, and save it to `/tutorials/flightdelays/output`.
trans-unit.target: This will retrieve a list of cities that experienced weather delays, along with the average delay time, and save it to `/tutorials/flightdelays/output`.

trans-unit.source: Later, Sqoop will read the data from this location and export it to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Later, Sqoop will read the data from this location and export it to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create an Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create an Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This will be used to hold data exported from HDInsight through Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: This will be used to hold data exported from HDInsight through Sqoop.

trans-unit.source: From your develoment environment where Azure CLI is installed, use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: From your develoment environment where Azure CLI is installed, use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: For exmaple, `azure sql server create admin password "West US"`.
trans-unit.target: For exmaple, `azure sql server create admin password "West US"`.

trans-unit.source: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Note the server name returned by this command.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Note the server name returned by this command.

trans-unit.source: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.
trans-unit.target: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.

trans-unit.source: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is `<shortname>.database.windows.net`.
trans-unit.target: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is `<shortname>.database.windows.net`.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a database named **sqooptest** on the SQL Database server:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a database named **sqooptest** on the SQL Database server:

trans-unit.source: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.
trans-unit.target: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add your client workstation's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add your client workstation's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Database table
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Database table

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use [FreeTDS](http://www.freetds.org/) from the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use [FreeTDS](http://www.freetds.org/) from the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster, and run the following steps from the SSH session.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster, and run the following steps from the SSH session.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to install FreeTDS:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to install FreeTDS:

trans-unit.source: Once FreeTDS has been installed, use the following command to connect to the SQL Database server you created previously:
trans-unit.target: Once FreeTDS has been installed, use the following command to connect to the SQL Database server you created previously:

trans-unit.source: You will receive output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You will receive output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: At the `1>` prompt, enter the following lines:
trans-unit.target: At the `1>` prompt, enter the following lines:

trans-unit.source: When the `GO` statement is entered, the previous statements will be evaluated.
trans-unit.target: When the `GO` statement is entered, the previous statements will be evaluated.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new table named __delays__, with a clustered index (required by SQL Database.)
trans-unit.target: This will create a new table named __delays__, with a clustered index (required by SQL Database.)

trans-unit.source: Use the following to verify that the table has been created:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to verify that the table has been created:

trans-unit.source: You should see output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter `exit` at the `1>` prompt to exit the tsql utility.
trans-unit.target: Enter `exit` at the `1>` prompt to exit the tsql utility.

trans-unit.source: Export data with Sqoop
trans-unit.target: Export data with Sqoop

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a link to the SQL Server JDBC driver from the Sqoop lib directory.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a link to the SQL Server JDBC driver from the Sqoop lib directory.

trans-unit.source: This allows Sqoop to use this driver to talk to SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: This allows Sqoop to use this driver to talk to SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to verify that Sqoop can see your SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to verify that Sqoop can see your SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: This should return a list of databases, including the sqooptest database that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: This should return a list of databases, including the sqooptest database that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to export data from hivesampletable to the mobiledata table:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to export data from hivesampletable to the mobiledata table:

trans-unit.source: This instructs Sqoop to connect to SQL Database, to the sqooptest database, and export data from the wasb:///tutorials/flightdelays/output (where we stored the output of the hive query earlier,) to the delays table.
trans-unit.target: This instructs Sqoop to connect to SQL Database, to the sqooptest database, and export data from the wasb:///tutorials/flightdelays/output (where we stored the output of the hive query earlier,) to the delays table.

trans-unit.source: After the command completes, use the following to connect to the database using TSQL:
trans-unit.target: After the command completes, use the following to connect to the database using TSQL:

trans-unit.source: Once connected, use the following statements to verify that the data was exported to the mobiledata table:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, use the following statements to verify that the data was exported to the mobiledata table:

trans-unit.source: You should see a listing of data in the table.
trans-unit.target: You should see a listing of data in the table.

trans-unit.source: Type `exit` to exit the tsql utility.
trans-unit.target: Type `exit` to exit the tsql utility.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now you understand how to upload a file to Azure Blob storage, how to populate a Hive table by using the data from Azure Blob storage, how to run Hive queries, and how to use Sqoop to export data from HDFS to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Now you understand how to upload a file to Azure Blob storage, how to populate a Hive table by using the data from Azure Blob storage, how to run Hive queries, and how to use Sqoop to export data from HDFS to an Azure SQL database.
